glsa.title: NVClock: Insecure file usage
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability has been discovered in NVClock, allowing for the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: NVClock is an utility for changing NVidia graphic chipsets internal frequency.

description.p: Tavis Ormandy of the Gentoo Linux Security Team discovered that NVClock makes usage of an insecure temporary file in the /tmp directory.

impact.p: A local attacker could create a specially crafted temporary file in /tmp to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running NVCLock.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All NVClock users should upgrade to the latest version:
